review: The device itself is awesome! Got mine for $20 as a Prime member when they launched and it does so much! Now, for the not so awesome part... My biggest gripe with the Fire TV Stick is getting it a solid internet connection. The WiFi strength of the Fire TV Stick isn't comparable to the WiFi strength of my phone. In my media room, my Galaxy S5 has a solid internet connection and can stream movies off Amazon, Netflix, etc. However, the Fire TV Stick won't even see I have WiFi in the media room. When I move it to the living room (really close to the WiFi router!), it gets an internet connection, but it doesn't seem blazing fast and movies will stop to buffer at times while other devices can watch a movie in the living room with no problem. With the small form factor, I understand an ethernet jack is out of the question, but you could at least engineer a device with WiFi as good as a typical smartphone! I continue to use my Fire TV Stick because it really is convenient and it does a great job when it has signal.
